title: 162-H
statement: H. Alternating casetime limit per test3 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutYou are given a string consisting of alphabet letters. Convert it to alternating case: the letters on odd positions should be in uppercase, and the letters on even positions should be lowercase. The letters are numbered staring from 1.InputThe only line of input contains a string between1and100characters long. Each character of the string is either an uppercase ('A'-'Z') or a lowercase ('a'-'z') letter.OutputOutput the resulting string.ExamplesInputCodeforcesOutputCoDeFoRcEsInputVKCupOutputVkCuP
